qas.question: When was The Deccan Times founded?
What type of paper is The Siasat Daily?
What year was the first radio station in Hyderabad formed?
On what date did the first public radio station in Hyderabad begin broadcasting?

context: One of Hyderabad's earliest newspapers, The Deccan Times, was established in <a0_0>the 1780s<a0_0/>. In modern times, the major Telugu dailies published in Hyderabad are Eenadu, Andhra Jyothy, Sakshi and Namaste Telangana, while the <a1_0>major English papers<a1_0/> are The Times of India, The Hindu and The Deccan Chronicle. The <a2_0>major Urdu papers<a2_0/> include The Siasat Daily, The Munsif Daily and Etemaad. Many coffee table magazines, professional magazines and research journals are also regularly published. The Secunderabad Cantonment Board established the first radio station in Hyderabad State <a3_0>around 1919<a3_0/>. Deccan Radio was the first radio public broadcast station in the city <a4_0>starting on 3 February 1935<a4_0/>, with FM broadcasting beginning in 2000. The available channels in Hyderabad include All India Radio, Radio Mirchi, Radio City, Red FM and Big FM.
